Number of applied filters.

filterData

filterData: any
  • Defined in src/table/table-header-item.class.ts:201

This is where you store your data when applying filter.

It is the actual object you have access to with let-filter="data" in your template.

Make sure to store data in filter.data in your template, and you will have it available in filterData.data in your extension of TableHeaderItem.

Because angular and object references.

filterFooter

filterFooter: TemplateRef<any>
  • Defined in src/table/table-header-item.class.ts:189

Used along with filterTemplate to construct the filter popover

filterTemplate

filterTemplate: TemplateRef<any>
  • Defined in src/table/table-header-item.class.ts:184

Used as a template for popover filter.

let-popover="popover" will give you access to popover component and allow you to manipulate it if needed.

let-filter="filter" will give you access to the "filter". The main takeaway is store the data you need to filter.data. You will be able to access it as this.filterData.data from your filter() function when you extend TableHeaderItem

Example:

<ng-template #filter let-popover="popover">
    <ibm-label class="first-label">
        Value
        <input type="text" [(ngModel)]="filter1" class="input-field">
    </ibm-label>
</ng-template>

<ng-template #filterFooter let-popover="popover" let-filter="data">
    <button class="btn--primary" (click)="filter.data = filter1; popover.onClose()">Apply</button>
    <button class="btn--secondary" (click)="popover.onClose()">Cancel</button>
</ng-template>

Set the template with, for example:

new FilterableHeaderItem({
    filterTemplate: this.filter,
    filterFooter: this.filterFooter
})
class FilterableHeaderItem extends TableHeaderItem {
    // custom filter function
    filter(item: TableItem): boolean {
        if (typeof item.data === "string" && item.data.indexOf(this.filterData.data) >= 0) {
            this.filterCount = 1;
            return false;
        }
        this.filterCount = 0;
        return true;
    }
}

sortable

sortable: boolean = true
  • Defined in src/table/table-header-item.class.ts:25

Enables sorting on click by default. If false then this column won't show a sorting arrow at all.

sorted

sorted: boolean = false
  • Defined in src/table/table-header-item.class.ts:18

Disables sorting by default.

style

style: object
  • Defined in src/table/table-header-item.class.ts:58

Style for the column, applied to every element in the column.

ngStyle-like format

Type declaration

template

template: TemplateRef<any>
  • Defined in src/table/table-header-item.class.ts:125

Used to display data in a desired way.

If not provided, displays data as a simple string.

Usage:

In a component where you're using the table create a template like:

<ng-template #customHeaderTemplate let-data="data">
        <i><a [routerLink]="data.link">{{data.name}}</a></i>
</ng-template>

where we assume your data contains link and name. let-data="data" is necessary for you to be able to access item's data in the template.

Create ViewChild property with:

(at)ViewChild("customHeaderTemplate")
protected customHeaderTemplate: TemplateRef<any>;

Set the template to the header item, for example:

this.model.header = [
        new TableHeaderItem({data: {name: "Custom header", link: "/table"}, template: this.customHeaderTemplate})
];

visible

visible: boolean = true
  • Defined in src/table/table-header-item.class.ts:12

Defines if column under this TableHeaderItem should be displayed.

Methods

compare

  • compare(one: TableItem, two: TableItem): number
    • Defined in src/table/table-header-item.class.ts:240

    Used for sorting rows of the table.

    Override to enable different sorting.

    < 0 if one should go before two

    0 if one should go after two 0 if it doesn't matter (they are the same)

    Parameters

    • one: TableItem
    • two: TableItem

    Returns number

filter

  • filter(item: TableItem): boolean
    • Defined in src/table/table-header-item.class.ts:269

    Used to filter rows in the table.

    Override to make a custom filter.

    Even though there is just one filter function, there can be multiple filters. When implementing filter, set filterCount before returning.

    true to hide the row false to show the row

    Parameters

    • item: TableItem

    Returns boolean
